page.title: 18CHIRNSIDE:JIM CLARK
page.content: Jim Clark was born on 4 March 1936 at Kilmany, Fife. When 6, Jim moved to Edington Mains, Chirnside. At 9 he drove his first car around the farm. He loved cars, and, with the help of 4 local businessmen, started to compete in motor racing events. In 1957 he won his first race, at Charterhall, near Duns. By 1963 he was the World Grand Prix Champion, a title he won again in 1965. He won 25 World Grand Prix races and many other honours. In 1968 on 7 April at Hockenheim, he was tragically killed in a Formula 2 race. He crashed into a clump of trees and was killed instantly. Jim Clark is remembered in Chirnside by the Jim Clark Memorial Clock and his grave in the Parish Churchyard. The Jim Clark Edington Trophy is presented every year at the school sports to the house winning the most points in track events.
